message.entry: Invalid value for MaxNumTimeSteps. The value must be an integer greater than 0.
Invalid size for MaxNumTimeSteps. The number of values cannot change, but a scalar will be expanded to match the original number of values.
Invalid values for MaxNumTimeSteps. The values must be unique. To change to non-unique values, construct a new TimeBuffer object.
Invalid value for MaxDimensions. The value for a single port TimeBuffer should be either a 1D vector.
Invalid value for MaxDimensions. The value should be a 2D matrix or a cell array.
Invalid value for NPorts. The value should be a positive integer.
Invalid size for MaxDimensions. For 2D matrix, the number of rows should be equal to the number of ports. For a cell array, the number of cell elements should be equal to the number of ports.
Invalid BufferType. The value should be either "SingleRate" or "MultipleRate".
Error during TimeBuffer construction.
Error in TimeBuffer.clear.
Invalid value for cutoff time in TimeBuffer.clearBackTo. The value should be a numeric scalar.
Error in TimeBuffer.clearBackTo.
Invalid input value in TimeBuffer.addValue. The value should be a numeric matrix.
Error in TimeBuffer.addValue. The dimension of Value should match with that of the last call to TimeBuffer.addTime.
Error in TimeBuffer.addTime. The input value should be a 1D vector or a scalar.
Invalid value for portID. It should be less than or equal to the number of ports.
Error in TimeBuffer.getTimeAndValue. The number of values added in the TimeBuffer should match the number of time steps added.
Invalid value for the input argument. The input argument should not be empty.
Invalid value for TimeBuffer.addValue. The dimensions of the input should match MaxDimensions and the number of time steps in the last call to TimeBuffer.addTime.
The port specified doesn't support complex data.
Complex Part of the data for the specified port is corrupted.
The size of the complexity array should be the same as the number of ports
Internal Error: Assertion.
Invalid size for MaxNumTimeSteps. The number of values should be equal to the Number of Ports.
